result.execSummary:
The defendant Gary H Watson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: --to pay costs of $268, plus $250 DNA surcharge, plus $33 summons fee, plus $180 buy-money reimbursement

--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with all recommended treatment
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, or counseling as required by the Agent
--random urinalyses or other drug testing, to occur at least once per month for the first six months of the Probation term
--to maintain fulltime employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--no possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--no contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate by the Agent, and except for incidental contact as needed for employment and educational purposes as approved by the Agent
--to comply with DNA sample provision

Arresting Agency: JCSD

If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.


The Court grants the Defendant's request for expungement upon his successful completion of the Probation term.  The Court clarifies to Mr. Watson that he will need to file a petition for expungement.

records.addlTxt: With elements and criminal case settlement agreement forms attached.

[Clerk: MK]
case called at 9:01am.
Defendant Gary H Watson in court with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

Mr. Watson waives his right to Preliminary Hearing. The Court accepts this waiver and binds Mr. Watson over for trial. 
Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " No Contest  " entered on Count #1; factual basis stipulated; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Counts # 2 & #3.

On Count #1, the Court withholds sentence, and places Mr. Watson on Probation for 18 months, with conditions:

--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with all recommended treatment
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, or counseling as required by the Agent
--random urinalyses or other drug testing, to occur at least once per month for the first six months of the Probation term
--to maintain fulltime employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--no possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--no contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate by the Agent, and except for incidental contact as needed for employment and educational purposes as approved by the Agent
--to comply with DNA sample provision
--to pay costs of $268, plus $250 DNA surcharge, plus $33 summons fee, plus $180 buy-money reimbursement, plus $75 drug testing fee


Days credit for time already served:  0 days
The Court grants the Defendant's request for expungement upon his successful completion of the Probation term.  The Court clarifies to Mr. Watson that he will need to file a petition for expungement. 
Felony firearm/voting prohibition warnings given.
recess 9:18am.
Preliminary hearing on July 28, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on July 9, 2014 at 02:20 pm.
